intro: Eriocaulon sphagnoides, commonly known as the bog moss, is a species of flowering plant in the family Eriocaulaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and is typically found in wet, acidic environments such as bogs and marshes. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in spikes, and it has a fibrous root system adapted to waterlogged soils. Eriocaulon sphagnoides plays an important role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its habitat. Its presence is often an indicator of undisturbed, moist ecosystems.
